articles.title: What Apple’s Native Containers Mean for Docker Users
articles.description: Did you know you can now run containers natively on macOS? At WWDC 2025, Apple announced Containerization and Container CLI — in other words, native Linux container support. Historically, running containers on macOS required launching a full Linux VM, typically via HyperKit or QEMU, to host the Docker Engine. That’s no longer necessary.
